title: Friday, 12th May, 2017

PM11:09am

Let's have a pic of Hapless Jes

PM11:09am

11:09 am
PM11:09am

Worry not of tomorrow’s end
Hurry not towards falling trees
Ignore at once, the jesters dance
Sigh, oh sigh, at the folly foiled
Take down the mighty route of ills
Lest not make a scratch in time
Evenhanded wins fair stance.
Broken wooden spoons we take
Left, oh left, in such a state
Over crests and furrowed field
Wirey talons arching back
Empty roosts the plagued aspise
Revel in their bloodied eyes

We fight on.

PM11:18am

I'm minded to mention Astrazeneca, but dare I tackle Imfinzi when Bryce is not here?

11:18 am
AstraZeneca PLC (AZN:LSE): Last: 4,973, up 225.5 (+4.75%), High: 4,998, Low: 4,902, Volume: 1.68m
PM11:18am

Let me get someone else to explain

PM11:19am

AstraZeneca has announced this morning that its anti-PD-L1 checkpoint inhibitor Imfinzi (durvalumab) has met a primary endpoint in the Phase 3 PACIFIC trial of patients with locally-advanced, unresectable (Stage III) non-small lung cancer (NSCLC) who had not progressed following standard platinum-based chemotherapy alongside radiation therapy.

11:19 am
PM11:19am

mfinzi achieved a “statistically-significant” and “clinically-meaningful” improvement in progression free survival (PFS). The announcement follows a planned interim analysis conducted by an independent Data Monitoring Committee. The trial will also assess overall survival (OS) in due course.

PM11:19am

Imfinzi is also under investigation in the Phase 3 MYSTIC trial which is investigating the drug (as monotherapy and in combination with tremelimumab) in patients with Stage IV NSCLC and no prior treatment, in comparison with the PACIFIC trial data announced today which is in unresectable, Stage III NSCLC patients following chemoradiation therapy.

PM11:19am

That's Tara Raveendran from Shore

11:19 am
PM11:19am

Dr Tara Raveendran

PM11:19am

Who is actually a seller

PM11:20am

And some Roger Franklin

11:20 am
PM11:20am

Liberum

PM11:20am

Roger's a buyer

PM11:20am

Astra announced this morning that the PACIFIC Phase 3 study of durvalumab in stage III unresectable lung cancer (NSCLC) read out positive data at pre-planned interim analysis with the independent data monitoring committee concluding the drug had already met a primary endpoint by showing statistically significant and clinically meaningful PFS. PACIFIC was a readout that hadn't been expected until H2 2017 so this is an earlier than expected surprise and was anyway seen, we believe, as one of the more speculative studies in terms of the chances of success given the paucity of previous data in the setting and all-comers design. Furthermore durva is the first I-O drug to show improved PFS in this setting.

11:20 am
PM11:20am

In terms of impact (i) we think this will significantly increase confidence in AZ's overall I-O franchise given this is a positive Phase 3 readout (ii) the fact the success was 'clinically meaningful' and in all-comers suggests meaningful commercial potential, even assuming use predominantly in PDL1+ve patients alone gets us to de-risked potential worth 3-4% of market cap to which we had applied a heavy 30% risk adjustment. In summary, this is very good news for AZ and we reiterate our view that the risk/reward is skewed to the upside ahead of further readouts albeit in the short term the shares are highly leveraged to a small number of upcoming catalysts (incl. MYSTIC mid-year).

PM11:21am

And therefore welcomes this positive surprise.

PM11:21am

Always good to see advances on the lung cancer front -- if, like, me you smoked 40 a day for 20 years...

11:24 am
BE11:24am

It was a not entirely surprising decision, so I'm struggling a little to explain the day 2 fall.

Hikma Pharmaceuticals PLC (HIK:LSE): Last: 1,751, down 44 (-2.45%), High: 1,807, Low: 1,719, Volume: 411.02k
PM11:25am

hmm

11:25 am
BE11:25am

Given management's guidance was for H2'17 launch despite the 10 May action date, a lack of first time approval is not entirely surprising. Indeed, our Hikma generic Advair estimate ($100m, FY17E) had assumed a September 2017 launch allowing for some delay. However, with the CRL classified as 'Major' (warrants a 10-month FDA review time upon resubmission) the likelihood of approval this year now appears almost zero, echoing Hikma's view per the release this morning.

BE11:25am

That's Barclays.

BE11:26am

There's also the Vectura angle .....

11:26 am
Vectura Group PLC (VEC:LSE): Last: 131.95, up 0.05 (+0.04%), High: 133.50, Low: 129.10, Volume: 940.29k
BE11:26am

Where there's a certain amount of knife catching going on.

BE11:26am

Singer, for instance.

11:27 am
BE11:27am

Following yesterday’s news of a Complete Response Letter from the FDA in relation to VR315 / generic Advair®, we
have delayed expected US approval and launch of the fixed-drug combination to late 2018e. The negative share
price reaction to the news was in line with the expectations outlined in our note “VR315 risk outweighs longer-term
potential” on 24th April. At the current level, we consider the stock fairly valued: we upgrade our recommendation
from Sell to Hold.

BE11:27am

This is Dr Jens Lindqvist, who called the non-approval correctly about a month ago.

BE11:27am

Our revised forecasts are based on the assumption that outstanding items can be addressed to the FDA’s satisfaction
over the coming months, which (assuming a 10-month review period) could result in approval of the ANDA in H2 2018.
As a result, we have moved the expected $11m milestone receivable on regulatory approval to H2 2018 and removed
£11.4m of expected VR315 US royalties from current-year forecasts. We now forecast US launch by end-2018, with
material royalties from 2019e onwards. The net result is a downgrade to expected FY2017-19 revenue from £186.9m,
£237.1m and £275.8m respectively to £166.7m (-10.8%), £222.1m (-6.3%) and £253.9m (-7.9%), with commensurate
reductions to expected EBITDA. Given our already conservative valuation of VR315, the impact on valuation is minor,
and offset by unrelated rNPV adjustments. Our target price remains broadly unchanged at 134p (from 131p).

11:27 am
PM11:28am

Good call that

BE11:28am

RBC even more cautious.

BE11:28am

We updated our forecasts to reflect a 2019 launch (assuming by April-2019) and with a lower, $250m from $300m, peak sales number given likely deterioration in market value. We have also updated for recent FX rates (shaving £2m-£3m off revenues) post discussions with the company. Revenues are coming down 7.4%/8.2%/2.0% over the FY17-19E period with EBITDA down 28.2%/24.2%/7.5%. There could be an 'offset' from lower R&D spend but we have no visibility on this, yet. At $250m we believe this would still be one of (if not the) biggest product in Hikma's portfolio and hence think it unlikely that they will 'give up' unless FDA discussions are meaningfully negative.

11:28 am
BE11:28am

We have lowered our SoTP valuation to 127p from 133p given the changes to VR315 and reiterate our Underperform rating. Whilst the shares are trading close to fair value (as we write this) we struggle to see the bull case as i) consensus downgrades set to come, ii) no clear catalyst until 2018/19 ex-VR315 and iii) until greater clarity provided on VR315 timeline. With the company trading on meaningful multiples, we can't see these expanding, and based on current peer multiples of ~16x EBITDA, think the shares could more likely trade in the 110p-120p range or lower, for now.

BE11:28am

Given the risk associated with assets not yet approved by regulators or still in their launch phase we utilise a SoTP model; for partnered launched assets we utilise NPV analysis with a WACC rate of 8% (Vectura is net cash) and no terminal value beyond Vectura’s patent protection. For partnered pipeline assets we use risk-adjusted NPVs with a discount rate of 10%, standard industry associated risk adjustments and no terminal value beyond Vectura’s patent protection on the products. For wholly owned pipeline assets we also use a rNPV (again a discount rate of 10% and standard risk adjustments) but apply a terminal with a growth rate of -2.5%. This provides our price target of 127p, which supports our Underperform rating.

BE11:29am

And from the GSK perspective, Investec .....

11:29 am
GlaxoSmithKline PLC (GSK:LSE): Last: 1,644, up 16.5 (+1.01%), High: 1,651, Low: 1,636, Volume: 3.23m
BE11:29am

GlaxoSmithKline (Buy, PT 1,800p). Delayed generic launches to 2H18 (our updated base case) has the trajectory of Advair near term declines soften. We extrapolate the current c. -20% US CER decline to end-1H18E. Aligned with management guidance, we now model 5% 2018E CER group EPS growth. Although the magnitude of the incremental operating profit is material to our near term forecast P&L (c£450m for 2017E), we do not ascribe a multiple to the related earnings, and therefore see a de-minimus impact on valuation. We acknowledge that delayed generics give GSK a greater window to affect a switch on to their newer respiratory portfolio, but do not make material changes to related growth rates at this time.

BE11:31am

.... which is the point, I guess. It's another year of earnings, but it's not repeat business. Remember having this conversation a lot on how to value Indivior when it was part of Reckitt and living on borrowed time in terms of the patent expiry.

Ortadog ̆u Antalya and Bodrum Liman, and is currently Managing Director of the Real Estate Division of GIH. Inaddition, she has served as a member of the board of directors of Dag ̆ören Enerji, Global Enerji, GlobalInsurance, Mavi Bayrak and Torba, and Chairman of the board of directors of Salıpazarı I ̇ns ̧aat. Until the sale ofGlobal Hayat in 2005, Mrs. Bensel was Chairman of the board of directors of Global Hayat and had served as itsChief Executive Officer since its formation in 2003. Mrs. Bensel has also been a member of the board ofdirectors of Global Securities since its formation in 2004. In addition, she has also served as the CEO of PeraReit Company. Previously, Mrs. Bensel was Co-Director of Research within Global Securities from 1998 to1999, and Assistant Director of Research from 1993 to 1998. Prior to joining Global Securities as an equityresearch analyst in 1991, Mrs. Bensel was a manager in foreign exchange dealings in the Turkish banking sector.Mrs. Bensel holds a BA in Business Administration and Finance from Hacettepe University, Ankara.The Right Honorable Peter Benjamin Mandelson (Independent Board Member)Lord Mandelson was appointed as a member of the Board of the Company on 12 April 2017. He is a formerEuropean Trade Commissioner and British First Secretary of State. As Trade Commissioner between 2004 and2008, he negotiated trade agreements with many countries and led European negotiations in the WTO DohaWorld Trade Round. Prior to this, he was Minister without Portfolio, Secretary of State for Trade and Industry,Northern Ireland Secretary and Secretary of State for Business, Innovation and Skills in the British governmentunder Tony Blair and Gordon Brown between 1997 and 2010. He was Member of Parliament for Hartlepool inthe UK from 1992 until 2004 and Director of Campaigns and Communications for the Labour party between1985 and 1990. Lord Mandelson is President of the Great Britain China Centre, a non-departmental public bodywhich encourages dialogue and collaboration between Britain and China, and is President of the German BritishForum, the UK’s primary bilateral forum for promoting dialogue on German-British business, social and politicalissues. He is Chancellor of Manchester Metropolitan University and is also President of the Policy Network thinktank and Senior Adviser to Lazard.

The Board has taken external advice from independent remuneration consultants as to the appropriate package for Mr Chahin, given his existing arrangements, the position of the Company and what is appropriate in the current market. In light of this, the Committee resolved on 9 May 2017 to grant Mr Chahin a right to acquire up to 10,000,000 ordinary shares in the Company (the "Option") at a nil cost under the Plan.

The Option shall be exercisable subject to and in accordance with the rules of the Plan including the extent to which certain performance conditions are satisfied over the performance period commencing on the date of grant and ending on 31 March 2022. The Option's performance conditions relate to the Company's share price performance and the maintenance of annual cash costs below a certain level, and malus and clawback provisions apply.

Improbable, which has never disclosed revenues and is still in beta mode, has built a platform called SpatialOS. It distributes computing power across thousands of servers, like a giant supercomputer, and enables highly detailed modelling of lifelike situations, such as a marine ecosystem.

BE11:44am

Consider this: Improbable raised just $20m in its Series A round two years ago. For those uninitiated in venture capital, this is an enormous leap. In fact, it’s the largest-ever Series B investment in Europe and the biggest venture financing round by a private British company in history.

BE11:47am

Anyway, here's Louis Capital on the DT story ....

11:47 am
BE11:47am

Does this really surprise anyone? Sprint alongside Verizon and AT&T are all losing customer to TMOB US which is the only operator in US gaining market share. Sprint shares are down 15% since their own results when it became evident that TMOB US is hurting everyone across the spectrum - Sprint at the bottom and Verizon and AT&T at the top. SPRINT NEEDS TMOB US TO SAVE ITSELF. I am not sure if TMOB US needs to rush into any deals with Sprint. Yes a deal will be hugely earning accretive (+33% on EPS) but there are better strategic suitors available, in my view.

BE11:47am

DT IS POSSIBLY LESS INTERESTED IN SPRINT THAN IT MIGHT HAVE BEEN IN 2013 - Since Sprint's last attempt to acquire TMOB US, the fortunes of one of the two companies has changed dramatically. TMOB US is now nearly 6x larger (market cap) than when Sprint last made an attempt to acquire the company. John Legere has transformed TMOB US from a laggard into a leader with a marketing machine which is the envy of the industry.

BE11:48am

TMOB/SPRINT MERGER HAS HUGE FINANCIAL BENEFITS - $35BN OF SYNERGIES BUT OTHER SUITORS MIGHT BE A BETTER STRATEGIC FIT- A potential merger comes with a very strong financial rationale. The synergies can be as high as $35bn and the impact on DT's EPS can be a massive 33%. However, there are other suitors in play such as cable companies which might be a better strategic fit over the longer term.

11:48 am
BE11:48am

In January, John Malone (chairman of Liberty Corp.) said that the three major cable TV companies in the US can join forces and buy TMOB US. Speaking at the Lions Gate Entertainment Corp. investor event which is a new addition to his media portfolio, he reiterated his belief that a Trump Presidency will result in more M&A and less regulatory oversight, driving the convergence between the worlds of media (content) and telecom (distribution). His media portfolio includes the US cable company Charter Communications which is the second largest US cable TV provider and will be expected to play a central role in any future consolidation.

BE11:49am

So, the gist of the argument here is that DT won't be rushed given there are any number of possible deals on the table.

Forterra PLC (FORT:LSE): Last: 254.00, up 6 (+2.42%), High: 254.00, Low: 250.00, Volume: 452.00k
BE11:53am

Here's the upshot.

11:53 am
BE11:53am

Lead analyst here is Lushanthan Mahendrarajah.

BE11:53am

Yes, I cut and pasted that.

BE11:54am

Following the result of the EU referendum in June 2016, the sell-side slashed its earnings estimates for the UK construction sector. However, since the November trading updates, earnings momentum has been positive while valuations have recovered to above two-year average levels. Based on our analysis herein, we favour exposure to new-build residential activity and identify the names we think are the best and worst placed.

11:54 am
BE11:54am

New-build residential construction - strong fundamentals intact but don’t expect the highs of 2013-14: We are optimistic on the near-term outlook for UK new-build residential construction as a result of government stimulus (eg the extension of the Help to Buy scheme). Longer term, we remain positive given the c1m housing shortage and growing support for SMEs. In our view, reducing the bottlenecks that SMEs face is key to accelerating housing supply.
● Nearer term we are cautious on RMI spend but the fundamentals are positive: We are cautious on RMI spending given subdued consumer confidence and the slowdown in housing transactions. Longer term, we believe there is pent-up demand in the RMI (repair, maintenance and improvement) market.

BE11:54am

● Non-residential construction is late cycle and has so far seen a limited impact from Brexit: We do not anticipate the decline in spending that other construction bodies are forecasting for 2017. Since Euroconstruct published its forecasts, lead indicators such as new orders, the construction PMI and business confidence have been positive, while the CPA has consistently upgraded its forecasts.
● Solid foundations in the UK brick market: Our positive view on housing starts should translate into brick volumes as 80% of new UK houses use brick cladding. The market is consolidated with three players having greater than 90% market share. High barriers to entry mean it is unlikely there will be any new major entrants into the market, With industry utilisation levels of c90% and a positive mix effect from merchant demand, we envisage prices and returns will continue to grow.

BE11:55am

● Ibstock (Buy, 34% upside) – our top pick: As the leading manufacturer of bricks in the UK, Ibstock is well placed to take advantage of these strong fundamentals. Its new SM3 plant should help the group take market share and lower its cost base while its US exposure will continue to be supportive to growth. Strong FCF generation will aid its bolt-on strategy and increase the probability of further shareholder returns. Valuation: 11.7x 2017 P/E; 8.9x EV/EBITDA.
● Forterra (Buy, 31% upside) – the value play: A pure play on the UK, being the second largest brick manufacturer. An efficient asset base combined with the lower capital employed concrete business means the group will continue to deliver a sectorleading ROIC while its strong FCF generation and a quality balance sheet leaves plenty of options. Valuation: 10.4x 2017 P/E; 7.4x EV/EBITDA.

11:56 am
BE11:56am

BE11:56am

11:57 am
PM11:58am

But it's mainly just flows!

PM11:58am

Talking Points
Risk-on Flows: $8.8bn into equities, $4.4bn into bonds, $0.1bn out of gold

Allez les Flows: record inflow of $6.1bn to Europe equities post Macron win (Chart 1); but our European Equity Strategist Ronan Carr argues Europe inflows barely halfway to levels consistent with prior SX5E market peaks (link)

Buy in May, and go Nikkei: Japan now the contrarian "buy"…largest equity outflow in 30 weeks ($2.7bn); divergent equity flow trends between Europe & Japan imply further appreciation of Euro vs Japanese yen (Chart 2)

Au Revoir le Vol: BofAML private clients reducing cash (10.9%, lowest level since Jul'15); and resume buying of low-volatility ETFs past 4 weeks (Chart 6 - was #1 ETF winner in 2016), just as equity volatility drops to lowest since 1993, US Treasury vol to lowest since 2014, CDS vol to lowest on record

PM11:58am

Davids vs. Goliaths: $174.9bn inflows to "passive" equity funds vs. $48.1bn outflows from "active" YTD…but this week biggest inflow to "active" in 80 weeks ($0.9bn); $1.6tn inflows to bond funds in past 10 years vs $0.2tn into equity funds…but equity ($126.8bn) keeping pace with bond inflows ($144.1bn) YTD

The QE Empire Strikes Back: central banks ($1.2tn asset purchases YTD) biggest driver of a. big stock and bond gains, and b. renewed tech leadership in equities (Nasdaq on course for 66% gain in 2017, best since 1999) and high yield leadership in bonds (CCC-rated Junk bonds annualizing 20% gain); Wall St pain trade up until they tighten

EPS meat on Liquidity bones: global EPS growth visibly more resilient in 2017 than prior 5 years; EPS growth in EM (19.6%) & Europe (14.5%) eye-catching versus 2012-2016 (Charts 3-4); Liquidity + EPS = we remain bullish until hubristic Positioning, peak Profits, tighter monetary Policy induces "Big Top" later in 2017

11:58 am
